Zend_Gdata  
Gdata  
No 
No 

Description

Gdata Http Client object.

Class to extend the generic Zend Http Client with the ability to perform secure AuthSub requests


Methods

_prepareBody, filterHttpRequest, filterHttpResponse, getAdapter, getAuthSubPrivateKeyId, getAuthSubToken, getClientLoginToken, getStreamingRequest, resetParameters, setAdapter, setAuthSubPrivateKey, setAuthSubPrivateKeyFile, setAuthSubToken, setClientLoginToken, setRawDataStream, setStreamingRequest,

_prepareBody( ) : string

Description

Prepare the request body (for POST and PUT requests)

Return value

Type Description
string

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Http_Client_Exception

filterHttpRequest( string   $method, string   $url, array   $headers = array, string   $body = null, string   $contentType = null, ) : array

Description

Filters the HTTP requests being sent to add the Authorization header.

If both AuthSub and ClientLogin tokens are set, AuthSub takes precedence. If an AuthSub key is set, then secure AuthSub authentication is used, and the request is signed. Requests must be signed only with the private key corresponding to the public key registered with Google. If an AuthSub key is set, but openssl support is not enabled in the PHP installation, an exception is thrown.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$method string | The HTTP method
$url string | The URL
$headers array | An associate array of headers to be sent with the request or null array
$body string | The body of the request or null null
$contentType string | The MIME content type of the body or null null

Return value

Type Description
array The processed values in an associative array, using the same names as the params

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Gdata_App_Exception if there was a signing failure

setAuthSubPrivateKey( string   $key, string   $passphrase = null, ) : Zend_Gdata_HttpClient

Description

Sets the PEM formatted private key to be used for secure AuthSub auth.

In order to call this method, openssl must be enabled in your PHP installation. Otherwise, a Zend_Gdata_App_InvalidArgumentException will be thrown.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$key string | The private key
$passphrase string | The optional private key passphrase null

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_HttpClient Provides a fluent interface

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Gdata_App_InvalidArgumentException

setAuthSubPrivateKeyFile( string   $file, string   $passphrase = null, bool   $useIncludePath = false, ) : void

Description

Sets the PEM formatted private key, as read from a file.

This method reads the file and then calls setAuthSubPrivateKey() with the file contents.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$file string | The location of the file containing the PEM key
$passphrase string | The optional private key passphrase null
$useIncludePath bool | Whether to search the include_path for the file false

Return value

Type Description
void

setRawDataStream( string   $data, string   $enctype = null, ) : Zend_Http_Client

Description

Set the raw (already encoded) POST data from a stream source.

This is used to support POSTing from open file handles without caching the entire body into memory. It is a wrapper around Zend_Http_Client::setRawData().


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$data string | The request data
$enctype string | The encoding type null

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Http_Client

setStreamingRequest( boolean   $value, ) : void

Description

Set the streamingRequest variable which controls whether we are sending the raw (already encoded) POST data from a stream source.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value boolean | The value to set.

Return value

Type Description
void

Properties

$_authSubPrivateKeyId, $_authSubToken, $_clientLoginKey, $_clientLoginToken, $_streamingRequest,

  private  $_authSubPrivateKeyId = null

OpenSSL private key resource id This key is used for AuthSub authentication. If this value is set, it is assuemd that secure AuthSub is desired.resource


  private  $_authSubToken = null

Token for AuthSub authentication.string
<p>If this token is set, AuthSub authentication is used.</p>

  private  $_clientLoginKey = null

Token for ClientLogin authentication.string
<p>If this token is set, and the AuthSub key is not set, ClientLogin authentication is used</p>

  private  $_clientLoginToken = null

Token for ClientLogin authentication.string
<p>If only this token is set, ClientLogin authentication is used.</p>

  protected  $_streamingRequest = null

True if this request is being made with data supplied by a stream object instead of a raw encoded string.bool
